notice.en: Required Course for Management Group of first grade of master and Information System Group of first grade of PhD students
notice.ch: 碩一管理組及博一資訊系統組必修

remark.ch: 碩一管理組及博一資訊系統組必修
remark.en: Required Course for Management Group of first grade of master and Information System Group of first grade of PhD students

goal.ch: "The objective of this course is to help students produce high quality research for their thesis. This course emphasizes the basic concepts and methods for performing empirical research in areas of social science. Although the load is not particularly heavy, students are asked to search and read several research papers in addition to the textbook."
goal.en: "The objective of this course is to help students produce high quality research for their thesis. This course emphasizes the basic concepts and methods for performing empirical research in areas of social science. Although the load is not particularly heavy, students are asked to search and read several research papers in addition to the textbook."

outline.ch:
"(02/17) Introduction to the course
(02/24) Ch. 1-3 (Notes#1)
1. Kerlinger & Lee, “Science and the Scientific Approach.” (Ch. 1)
2. D.A. Whtten, “What Constitutes a Theoretical Contribution.”
3. S.B. Bacharach, “Organizational Theories: Some Criteria for Evaluation.” (PhD)
(03/02) Ch. 4-5 (Notes#2)
1. Kerlinger & Lee, “Problems and Hypotheses.” (Ch. 2)
2. J.W. Creswell, Research Design: Qualitative & Quantitative Approaches, Sage1994. (in lib)
(Tells you about the contents and arrangements of a dissertation.)
(03/09) Ch. 6, 7 (Notes#3)
(03/16) Ch. 7, 10 (Notes#4)
1. J.M. Stanton, “An Empirical Assessment of Data Collection Using the Internet.”
2. E. Forrest, Internet Marketing Research: Resources and Techniques, McGraw Hill, 2001.
3. Zikmund, Ch. 7
(03/23) Ch. 8-9 (Notes#5)
1. Zikmund, Ch. 12-14
2. Kerlinger & Lee, “Constructs, Variables, and Definitions.” (Ch. 3)
3. A.H. Segars, “Assessing the Unidimensionality of Measurement: A Paradigm and Illustration within the Context of Information Systems Research.”
4. R.R. DeVellis, “Understanding the ‘Latent’ Variable.”
(03/30) Zikmund Ch. 6: Exploratory Research & Qualitative Analysis (Notes#6)
(04/06) Ch. 11-12 (Notes#7)
1. M.K. Malhotra and V. Grover, “An Assessment of Survey Research in POM: From Constructs to Theory.”
2. D. Jobber and D. O’Reilly, “Industrial Mail Survey: A Methodological Update.”
(04/13) Ch. 13-14 (Notes#8)
1. G.A. Wyner, “Experimental Design.” (A short summary article.)
2. Thesis writing if time permits
(04/20) Possible makeup class
(04/27) Survey Research—measurement (student presentation)
(05/04) Survey Research—theory-based study (student presentation)
(05/11) Experimental Research (student presentation)
(05/18) Use of Secondary Data (student presentation)
(05/25) Qualitative Analysis (student presentation)
(06/01) Final exam
(06/15) Term Paper Due at 5PM (submitted in Word format onto my ftp site)"

textbook.ch: "D.R. Cooper and P.S. Schindler, Business Research Methods, 12th Edition, McGraw-Hill. (華泰)"
textbook.en: "D.R. Cooper and P.S. Schindler, Business Research Methods, 12th Edition, McGraw-Hill. (華泰)"

gradMethod.ch:
"1. Presentation & Participation (attendance) (15%)
2. Final Exam (45%)—A close-book, in-class exam (all students must take the exam).
3. Research Proposal (40%)—Write up a research proposal on a topic of your own choice. (In English or in Chinese) It’s all right for those 2nd year master students to hand in the draft of your thesis. Note that the topic must be related to IT.
4. Doctoral students will have different standard for satisfying this course. You should at least try to perform better than the master students in both final exam and research proposal."
gradMethod.en:
"1. Presentation & Participation (attendance) (15%)
2. Final Exam (45%)—A close-book, in-class exam (all students must take the exam).
3. Research Proposal (40%)—Write up a research proposal on a topic of your own choice. (In English or in Chinese) It’s all right for those 2nd year master students to hand in the draft of your thesis. Note that the topic must be related to IT.
4. Doctoral students will have different standard for satisfying this course. You should at least try to perform better than the master students in both final exam and research proposal."
